title: Forget Binge Watching: Great Television Happens When Networks Pace Shows
teaser: The perfect example, says critic David Bianculli, is HBO's The Jinx: The Life and Deaths of Robert Durst. Spread out over six weeks, the finale had the most chilling TV moment he's seen in years.
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
